page.title: 09EGLINTON COUNTRY PARK
page.content: KILWINNING was ruled by the Earls of Eglinton for centuries but in 1920 the family through lack of money,gave up the castle and it fell into ruins. Mr. Clement Wilson bought it in 1959 and established a factory to process and can foods.He developed the grounds for people to visit.It is now a fine park owned by CUNNINGHAME DISTRICT COUNCIL.Recently it has become a country park.Thousands come here every year to cross the bridge the Earl had built for the great tournament of 1839 that ruined his family financially. A RANGER SERVICE has been introduced and a study centre established. Children are encouraged to visit the park to study plants and wildlife.
